      Given a two-argument equality with at least one variable argument, returns an equivalent equality with first argument guaranteed not to be a constant, guaranteeing that original instance is returned if both arguments are variables.
      static Expression makeWithConstantSimplification(Expression equality, Context context)
      Makes an equality application while removing duplicates, returning Expressions.FALSE if there is more than one uniquely named constant in arguments, and returning Expressions.TRUE if all arguments are identical.

      Makes an equality application on two terms possibly simplifying it (taking constants into account).
      static Expression normalize(Expression expression, Context context)
      Returns X = c, if 'expression' is c = X, for X a variable and c a constant, or 'expression' otherwise.
      static com.sri.ai.util.base.Pair<Expression,Expression> separateVariableLiteral(Expression variable, Expression literal, Context context)
      Given an equality literal L (using disequality or equality, the latter with possibly many arguments) and a variable V, returns a pair of equality literals (L1, L2) such that "L1 and L2 <=> L", and such that the only variable in L1 is V.

      • makeSureFirstArgumentIsNotAConstant

        public static Expression makeSureFirstArgumentIsNotAConstant(Expression twoArgumentEquality,
                                                             Context context)
        Given a two-argument equality with at least one variable argument, returns an equivalent equality with first argument guaranteed not to be a constant, guaranteeing that original instance is returned if both arguments are variables.

        public static Expression make(java.lang.Object... arguments)
        Makes an equality of some expressions, returning Expressions. Returns TRUE if the expressions are identical.

                                                        Expression term2,

        Makes an equality application on two terms possibly simplifying it (taking constants into account).

      • makeWithConstantSimplification

        public static Expression makeWithConstantSimplification(Expression equality,
                                                        Context context)
        Makes an equality application while removing duplicates, returning Expressions.FALSE if there is more than one uniquely named constant in arguments, and returning Expressions.TRUE if all arguments are identical.

      • getVariablesListAndConstantOrNullIfNoConstant

        public static com.sri.ai.util.base.Pair<java.util.List<Expression>,Expression> getVariablesListAndConstantOrNullIfNoConstant(Expression equality,
                                                                                                                             Context context)
        Assumes that first argument is an equality (with possibly more than two arguments) and returns a pair, the first member of which is a collection of the variables in the equality, and the second member of which is the first constant present. Returns null if there are no constants in the equality arguments.

      • getVariablesListAndConstantsList

        public static com.sri.ai.util.base.Pair<java.util.Set<Expression>,java.util.Set<Expression>> getVariablesListAndConstantsList(Expression equality,
                                                                                                                              Context context)
        Assumes that first argument is an equality (with possibly more than two arguments) and returns a pair, the first member of which is a set of the variables in the equality, and the second member of which is a set of constants in the equality.

      • isEquality

        public static boolean isEquality(Expression expression)

      • getSymbolsBoundToSomethingElse

        public static java.util.Set<Expression> getSymbolsBoundToSomethingElse(Expression equality)

      • normalize

        public static Expression normalize(Expression expression,
                                   Context context)
        Returns X = c, if 'expression' is c = X, for X a variable and c a constant, or 'expression' otherwise. It actually works for any other functor as well.

      • makePairwiseEquality

        public static Expression makePairwiseEquality(java.util.List<Expression> list1,
                                              java.util.List<Expression> list2)
        Returns a conjunction of equalities between the corresponding elements of two lists (two elements are corresponding if they have the indices). Returns false if the lists have different sizes.

      • separateVariableLiteral

        public static com.sri.ai.util.base.Pair<Expression,Expression> separateVariableLiteral(Expression variable,
                                                                                       Expression literal,
                                                                                       Context context)
        Given an equality literal L (using disequality or equality, the latter with possibly many arguments) and a variable V, returns a pair of equality literals (L1, L2) such that "L1 and L2 <=> L", and such that the only variable in L1 is V. Returns null if it is not an equality literal.

      • getWhatExpressionIsComparedToIfUniqueOrNull

        public static Expression getWhatExpressionIsComparedToIfUniqueOrNull(Expression equality,
                                                                     Expression expression)
        Receives an equality T1 = T2 = ... = Tn and an expression E. If n = 1 and E is equal to Ti, then returns Tj where j != i (the other term). Otherwise, returns null.

      • simplifyIfEqualityOrDisequality

        public static Expression simplifyIfEqualityOrDisequality(Expression expression,
                                                         Context context)
        Checks an expression for equality or disequality (top) simplification.
        Parameters:
        expression -
        context -

      • simplify

        public static Expression simplify(Expression equality,
                                  Context context)
        Returns TRUE if given equality has all-equal arguments, FALSE if they contain distinct constants, and the equality itself otherwise. Note that this is much faster than eliminating duplicates as well, which requires constructing another equality.

      • simplifyGivenEquality

        public static Expression simplifyGivenEquality(Expression equality,
                                               Expression variable,
                                               Expression otherTerm)
        Returns an expression equivalent to equality (and perhaps simpler) given equality between a variable and another term.

      • simplifyGivenDisequality

        public static Expression simplifyGivenDisequality(Expression equality,
                                                  Expression variable,
                                                  Expression otherTerm)
        Returns an expression equivalent to equality (and perhaps simpler) given a disequality.
